snippet: An unpopular subsidy that had long seemed untouchable is allowed to die amid concern for deficits and debt.
abstract: Federal tax credit for ethanol expires, ending three decades in which government provided more than $20 billion in subsidies for use of the product; unpopular subsidy that long seemed untouchable became a symbol of corporate welfare as the country has become more preoccupied with deficits and debt.
lead_paragraph: An unpopular subsidy that had long seemed untouchable is allowed to die amid concern for deficits and debt.

headline.seo: After Three Decades, Federal Tax Credit for Ethanol Expires
headline.main: After Three Decades, Tax Credit for Ethanol Expires
headline.print_headline: After Three Decades, Tax Credit for Ethanol Expires
